items.title: .readonly div and label overlap in the .aligned fieldset if the label is long
items.body: Django==1.11.20 django-cms==3.6.0 djangocms-admin-style==1.4.0 If the label is too long in the `.aligned` fieldset, the `.readonly` value overlaps the label. I believe this is because the width of the label is set to `auto`, https://github.com/divio/djangocms-admin-style/blob/5a280a05bb471c2c329d46ce3ea861d523ea88d1/djangocms_admin_style/sass/components/_forms.scss#L263 while the `left-margin` of the `.readonly` div is set to `170px` https://github.com/django/django/blame/43f54e136e9282f5c0bfcf1169d0d59b3c365add/django/contrib/admin/static/admin/css/forms.css#L90 `170px` value for the left margin seems to be dependant on the width of the label, which is set in django to `160px` https://github.com/django/django/blame/43f54e136e9282f5c0bfcf1169d0d59b3c365add/django/contrib/admin/static/admin/css/forms.css#L74

items.title: Use the standard Django CMS toolbar for admin pages
items.body:
In our project, we have quite a bit of functionality that staff users do directly in admin views, but as soon as they enter an admin site page, the standard Django CMS toolbar disappears.  Many users have found this confusing.

On a per-installation basis, it's possible to make all admin pages show the same toolbar as regular Django CMS pages by overriding templates/admin/inc/branding.html and templates/admin/base_site.html.  However, it would very nice to make this either default behavior, or at least behavior that could be easily enabled without overriding multiple templates.

Here's what would be needed:

- Add package dependencies to Django CMS and django-sekizai
- modify templates/admin/inc/branding.html to load cms_tags template tags and simply call the `{% cms_toolbar %}` template tag
- modify templates/admin/base_site.html to load sekizai_tags template tags and render the "css" and "js" blocks required to load static content for the Django CMS toolbar.

If you don't want to require Django CMS and django-sekizai for this app, then perhaps it would be possible to implement a parameter in settings that, if enabled (and if Django CMS and Sekizai are installed), loads the Django CMS toolbar in place of the current toolbar.

items.title: compatibility with django-constance
items.body: I have found a small issue with `django-constance`. Here's how it looks now: It all happens because of these lines: ```css .change-list #changelist table tbody td, .change-list #changelist table tbody th { white-space: nowrap; } ``` If I change it to: ```css .change-list #changelist table tbody td, .change-list #changelist table tbody th { white-space: normal; /* some others work too */ } ``` It all starts to work fine: I am using these versions: django-cms==3.4.2 django-constance[database]==2.0.0 djangocms-admin-style==1.2.6.2 # via django-cms

items.title: Regression in 1.2.4 if not using django.core.context_processors.request
items.body:
The new template tag that was added in `templatetags/admin_style_tags.py` in 1.2.4 ...

```
from django.contrib.sites.shortcuts import get_current_site

@register.simple_tag(takes_context=True)
def current_site_name(context):
    request = context.get('request')
    site = get_current_site(request)
    return site.name
```

... breaks Django projects that aren't using `django.core.context_processors.request`. This is a shame, because in 1.2.3 and earlier `djangocms-admin-style` didn't require `django.core.context_processors.request`. It seems a shame to introduce an unnecessary dependency.

The following changeset would fix it:

```
diff --git a/djangocms_admin_style/templatetags/admin_style_tags.py b/djangocms_admin_style/templatetags/admin_style_tags.py
index 8ba5de9..0d2fe20 100644
--- a/djangocms_admin_style/templatetags/admin_style_tags.py
+++ b/djangocms_admin_style/templatetags/admin_style_tags.py
@@ -19,6 +19,8 @@ register = template.Library()
 @register.simple_tag(takes_context=True)
 def current_site_name(context):
     request = context.get('request')
+    if request is None:
+        return 'My Site'
     site = get_current_site(request)
     return site.name
```

items.title: pattern selector for hiding related widget links is insufficiently selective
Fix datetime fields when grouped inline
items.body:
When in admin you group fields like that:

```
fields = (
    'field1',
    'field2',
    ('field3', 'field4'),
    'field5',
)
```

Both `field3` and `field4` will be on the same row. The problem is when one of this fields is a datetime field because it is already split on two separate fields.

This is how it should look like:
![djangocms-admin-style-datetime-fixed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/902381/16408875/67767fdc-3d23-11e6-9713-91947c5c1af5.png)

But now it looks like:
![djangocms-admin-style-datetime-broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/902381/16408892/892063c8-3d23-11e6-9c6c-d764e821234e.png)

Proposed solution:

```
.form-row p.datetime .vDateField{
    width: calc(100% - 151px)!important;
}
.form-row p.datetime .vTimeField{
    width: calc(100% - 152px)!important;
}
```

P.S. In the "How it should look like" i changed the styles for the select in order "delete" button to be on the same row: from `width: calc(100% - 91px)!important;` to `width: calc(100% - 132px)!important;`

items.title: Calendar next/previous links are invisible
items.body: The shortcut links `<` and `>` on the calendar widget are invisible. Technically, the top left and right corners of the widget are still clickable, but since the editors can't see them, they assume they don't exist, leading to frustration and confusion. I've tested against both 1.2.2 and the most recent commit fa1838def and the problem exists in both versions. Also, I've confirmed that if I disable djangcms-admin-style, Django's default calendar widget does not have this issue.

items.title: static/filer/icons/file_32x32.png is replaced with a 64x64.png image
items.body:
When we include djangocms_admin_style and run collectstatic, the static/filer/icons/file_32x32.png is updated.  However, the icon that gets created is actually 64x64!  I'm not familiar enough with this project's setup/build process to identify where in the pipeline the incorrect image is being generated.

Also, why does djangocms_admin_style overwrite static/filer/icons at all?  Those icons are used outside of the admin.

items.title: Bug: cant't return from CKEditor's "Maximize"
items.body:
When `maximize` button on CKEditor is clicked then Header bar is hiding top row of the CKEditor toolbar and now is unable to return from "maximized" state.

The issue is caused by the very large z-index of the `#header`. Now it is `9999` (https://github.com/divio/djangocms-admin-style/blob/master/djangocms_admin_style/sass/components/_header.scss#L19).
If it is reduced to `999` it's working.

If both the bar and maximized ckeditor need to stay I don't know how this need to be fixed.

items.body: currently it appears that a user's password is displayed without a possibility to change it (no link to the password change page as in the standard admin). Is there some option to enable this?

items.title: add "djangocms-admin-style" class to html tag
items.body:
when maintaining a third party django app, it can be difficult to support both django vanilla admin and djangocms-admin-style admin. adding a specific class to the html tag could resolve this situation, app maintainers could easily target their CSS to admin-style mode or vanilla mode.

it may also reduce the need to use !important, for admin-style itself?

items.title: Support of django versions
cleanup static file locations
items.body:
static files should be all namespaced inside a app folder inside `static`. Anything placed directly in `static` might clash with other static assets of the project.

So all djangocms-admin-style staticfiles should be in `static/djangocms_admin_style/`. Of course with the exception of static files that are overridden for other apps.
- [ ] [`static/js`](https://github.com/divio/djangocms-admin-style/tree/49301e0af6ed719ce9be86747df7504c4df324ef/djangocms_admin_style/static/js) should be in [`static/djangocms_admin_style/js/`](https://github.com/divio/djangocms-admin-style/tree/49301e0af6ed719ce9be86747df7504c4df324ef/djangocms_admin_style/static/djangocms_admin_style/).
- [ ] once django-filer 1.2.0 is released, `static/icons` and `static/filer/icons` can be removed

items.title: Input line height issue in linux
items.body:
Under certain conditions (eg Ubuntu using fallback font Verdana), the line height (12px) for input and select elements can be too low for the font size (12px), causing descenders and underscores to be cropped by the padding:

![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/241712/13455090/36b4d240-e053-11e5-9c51-47a68e5205fa.png)

120% line height should resolve this, which would be 14.4px, so I tried increasing the line height to large font size (16px) and reducing the vertical padding accordingly, but it caused problems in IE. This will therefore either need further css hackery to fix those issues, or it becomes a design decision around input element sizes and padding.

items.title: Add ability to make dropdown filter menu
items.body:
I think, good idea is to have option to make dropdown filter menu as django-cms page list:
![default](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11954799/13165858/21299efa-d6f4-11e5-817d-8d8545c16aa5.png)

Option may be like that:

```
@admin.register(Example)
class ExampleAdmin(DjangocmsAdminStyleMix, admin.ModelAdmin):
    ...
    dropdown_filter_list = True
```

horizontal fields in site admin
Djangocms Admin Style search box CSS broken with Django 1.9 and djangocms-admin-style==1.0.9
items.body:
Hi all, 

I recently upgraded to Django 1.9 and DjangoCMS 3.2.1.  I also updated djangocms-admin-style to the latest current version, 1.0.9.  Upon doing so, the search bar in the admin interface breaks for all instances where search_fields is set in the ModelAdmin.  I'm not able to click on the search box to make it active, and it appears broken in the layout.   I have reproduced this in Firefox (44.0) and in Chrome (50.0.2633.3)

See the screenshot below.  

I've run a collectstatic and have migrated everything upon doing this upgrade.  Here are the apps that I have installed. 

```
$ pip freeze
beautifulsoup4==4.4.0
dj-database-url==0.3.0 
Django==1.9.1
django-classy-tags==0.6.2
django-cms==3.2.1
django-extensions==1.6.1
django-formtools==1.0
django-htmlmin==0.9.0
django-nocaptcha-recaptcha==0.0.18
django-reversion==1.10.1
django-sekizai==0.9.0
Django-Select2==4.3.1
django-treebeard==4.0
djangocms-admin-style==1.0.9
djangocms-inherit==0.1.1
djangocms-link==1.7.1
djangocms-snippet==1.7.1
djangocms-teaser==0.2.0
djangocms-text-ckeditor==2.8.1
html5lib==0.999999
Pillow==3.1.0
psycopg2==2.6.1
six==1.9.0
sorl-thumbnail==12.3
wheel==0.24.0
```

![djangocms-admin-style-broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/417872/12711871/00755970-c889-11e5-948e-60b938d491df.jpg)

items.title: Re-enabling source maps without worrying about .css file sizes
Inline change link icon and text overlap
items.body: Hi there. When `show_change_link = True` in an `admin.TabularInline` class, the corresponding change link is styled improperly. It looks like this: It should look like this: The `inlinechangelink` class normally has a `padding-left` of `12px`: However, this is overridden and set to `0` with the `.tabular table td a` selector: Thanks!

items.title: The `filter_vertical` setting is broken. It is horizontal, instead.
items.body: I'm upgrading from `djangocms-admin-style==0.2.5` and noticed that the admin's [`filter_vertical`](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/ref/contrib/admin/#django.contrib.admin.ModelAdmin.filter_vertical) setting for many-to-many fields is no longer respected. A vertical filter is actually horizontal in `djangocms-admin-style==1.0.4`: Also, vanilla Django admin and the older django CMS admin kept the filter box sizes consistent. It seems weird having them lopsided like this.

items.title: Top right button requires site to be an attribute of request object
items.body:
Hi, 
I'm looking at the new admin interface. Nice work btw.

The top right button "Open _website name_" requires `site`  to be an attribute of request object.
I couldn't find any reference in the documentation.
This can be achieved with [`django.contrib.sites.middleware.CurrentSiteMiddleware` ](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/ref/middleware/#django.contrib.sites.middleware.CurrentSiteMiddleware).
The only concern is that the middleware was added to Django 1.7, but Django-CMS 3.2 still supports Django 1.6.

items.title: SCSS won't compile with Compass >= 1.x
items.body:
Since Compass 1.x release comes with a lot of deprecations, this is breaking scss compilation for most project built with Compass 0.x.

If i try to compile djangocms-admin-style scss with my Compass 1.x install it fails with some errors:

```
$ compass compile --force -c config_admin-style.rb
 modified config.rb
    clean /home/work/projects/pims/try-it/project/webapp_statics/djangocms_admin_style/css

         on line 47 of /home/work/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.1.1@foundation55/gems/compass-core-1.0.3/stylesheets/compass/typography/_vertical_rhythm.scss
         from line 4 of /home/work/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.1.1@foundation55/gems/compass-core-1.0.3/stylesheets/compass/_typography.scss

         from line 1 of /home/work/projects/pims/try-it/compass/admin_style/djangocms-admin.scss
```

I didn't try to fix it yet, so there is probably more errors to fix.

You should put a notice about that (Scss require Compass 0.x to compile) in your Readme or if you are interested to use Compass 1.x, i may be able to fix your scss within a pull request.

items.title: m2m Field styling
items.body:
styling for m2m fields is not so cute.

![bildschirmfoto 2015-09-14 um 17 16 56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/593335/9853567/7654f508-5b04-11e5-8941-ae2b699a91b7.png)

items.title: Replace compass against libsass
Do not add fixed length in form-input
Select box spills all of it's options all over the form
items.body:
I've got a multiple select field with the max-width set at 240px and the overflow visible.

This is surely an issue as it constrains the select box and then spills out all of it's options in the form?!

items.title: Cant override block usertools.
select multiple overflowing on chrome on backend
items.body:
I've got an m2m field in the admin that is overflowing the container on Chrome (works great on Firefox).

![screen shot 2015-01-13 at 4 59 15 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2245080/5730119/a9f33b92-9b45-11e4-983a-d2f8a5ff39b9.png)

I believe the issue is this line: https://github.com/divio/djangocms-admin-style/blob/master/djangocms_admin_style/sass/libs/html5-boilerplate/_styles.scss#L80

Maybe add a rule for `select[multiple]`?? and do `overflow: hidden` or `overflow: auto`. CSS in not my forté.

items.title: NoReverseMatch exception triggered on object deletion.
items.body:
Whenever you try to delete an object from the admin with Django 1.7 and Python 2.7, you end up with a `NoReverseMatch` exception raised in 

```
djangocms_admin_style/templates/admin/delete_selected_confirmation.html
```

The traceback says 

```
Reverse for 'app_list' with arguments '()' and keyword arguments '{u'app_label': ''}' not found.
```

and this is related to line 11 of the template which renders the nested menu (depicted below).
![screenshot from 2014-12-31 13 04 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6845103/5587563/3ae9529c-90ee-11e4-83f9-bb5b04dafd5a.png)

I can provide a fix that was successfully tested under Django 1.7 and Python 2.7 in a pull request if one of the contributors agrees.

items.title: retina screen icons messed up
items.body:
Apologies if I'm not doing this right but it appears I'm the first person to use this on a retina screen? This is what the admin looks like for me in an essentially base install. I'm running the latest Yosemite.

![screen shot 2014-12-20 at 9 17 27 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2245080/5516966/0604545e-888e-11e4-92dd-43a3b9ba4ae5.png)

items.title: Tag 0.2.3 release
items.body: The version was bumped but there isn't a git tag for 0.2.3

items.title: Make headings more defined
items.body:
In projects with a lot of stuff in the admin, it can be difficult to find what you are looking for as headings don't really stand out. 

Just my thoughts :)

items.title: ManyToManyField choices flow out of their box
items.body: ![m2m_issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5197123/4990394/893a694e-698f-11e4-8d07-07db57e539d2.png)

items.title: Django 1.7 Compatibility
items.body:
Presumably this is due to template changes in 1.7 but `admin.site.site_header`, `admin.site.site_title` aren't respected when djangocms-admin-style is installed.

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/contrib/admin/#django.contrib.admin.AdminSite.site_header

items.title: NoReverseMatch error with admin action list
items.body:
Hi,  when I use the action drop-down list to bulk delete objects in the admin panel,  I get this error.
![screen shot 2014-09-10 at 12 22 11 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/849403/4221133/e256ce32-3906-11e4-943d-3119cc01d5f8.png)
However,  deleting items individually works.

Fix button alignment, find a solution to the absolute positioning
items.body: see: https://github.com/divio/django-cms/issues/3004

items.title: Sometimes responsive tree view looking wierd
items.body: see https://github.com/divio/django-cms/issues/2853 as reference

items.title: filter_horizontal/filter_vertical don't look good
items.body:
We may want to exclude these boxes from the max-width css rule added in https://github.com/divio/djangocms-admin-style/commit/8739a5cb?

![filter_horizontal](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/411869/2369651/9866f55a-a7e2-11e3-82d3-8ccd7ec37fa1.png)

items.title: advanced settings button is not styled
items.body: https://github.com/divio/django-cms/issues/2666

items.title: ManyToManyField is hardly usable (django-cms v3.0)
items.body:
It looks like the two boxes which are used within the default admin have disappeared. It would be nice to have them back, as the current m2m multiselect field is hardly usable (especially with more than, say, 20 options in it):

![screen shot 2013-08-19 at 9 57 40 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/808271/988852/1c0a5096-090a-11e3-881f-bffef574ce53.png)

Additional: it is mainly because when you've selected 60 out of 150 options, and you accidentally click without control/command, you lose the whole selection...

Also you can't see in one view which options are selected and which are not. And last but not least the scrolling doesn't really work in the sidebar of the frontend (like everything scrolls a bit: the actual page, the admin sidebar and the multiselect field.

items.title: publishing pages in cms tree view kills node in view
Use {% static %} for support storage engines
items.body:
Hey,

You should consider using `{% static %}` to support alternative storage engines, like Amazon S3, instead of `{{ STATIC_URL }}`. Example: https://github.com/divio/djangocms-admin-style/blob/master/djangocms_admin_style/templates/admin/base_site.html#L6

items.title: textarea in plugin inlines
items.body:
http://cl.ly/image/1E3w1M2Y2f3c

.vLargeTextField, .vXMLLargeTextField { width: 48em; }

items.title: admin style breaks module content
items.body:
the .module class styles all the inner html. But when using custom html or wysiwygs it also overrides those styles.

.module table td for example adds unrequired padding to the ckeditor.
